definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: Lleras based his theory on the idea that our senses become used to stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 雷若斯的理论是以我们感官会习惯的外来刺激为根据。

sentences.english: You use all of your senses in guided imagery.
sentences.chinese: 在进行引导式景象刻画时，你要运用到一切感官。

sentences.english: Customers from a single point of view constitute a multi-sensory effects.
sentences.chinese: 让客户从单一角度构成多层次的感官效果。

sentences.english: In sensory psychology this effect is called a "positive afterimage."
sentences.chinese: 感官心理学将这种现象称作“正后像”。

sentences.english: According to Krauss, "Insanity is a dream in which the senses are awake."
sentences.chinese: 克劳斯认为，“精神错乱则是感官清醒时的梦。”

sentences.english: Our senses are more acute. We are more open to new experiences.
sentences.chinese: 感官变得更灵敏，更乐于接受新体验。

sentences.english: Repellency is not confined to the olfactory senses.
sentences.chinese: 防护性不只限于嗅觉感官。

sentences.english: The sensory properties of mulberry wine were its soft taste and strong and mellow aroma.
sentences.chinese: 桑椹酒感官特征为醇香浓郁，口感柔和。

sentences.english: Thereafter, one is no longer troubled by the dualities of sense-experience.
sentences.chinese: 这样，一个人不再受感官经验二元性的困扰。

sentences.english: It can't be detected at all by the five senses.
sentences.chinese: 五种感官都不发现不了。

sentences.english: Don't omit sensory details and a bit of color.
sentences.chinese: 不要忽略感官细节，注意生动性。

sentences.english: However, the Joy Diet encourages you to indulge in feasts for the other senses as well.
sentences.chinese: 然而“快乐大餐”鼓励人们也享用其它感官的大餐。

sentences.english: Anteaters possess a very simple sensory system for use in locating prey.
sentences.chinese: 靠一个非常简单的感官系统去定位猎物。

sentences.english: There was silence, too, in Shemsen's ears and in those sensitive places along his flanks .
sentences.chinese: 而且在舍姆森的耳中和肋部的感官处也没有声音。

sentences.english: This model is based on 4 sensorial experiences rated by maximum 20 points.
sentences.chinese: 该模型是基于最高20分，分为4个感官评定等级。

sentences.english: There are six doors through which sense-objects can enter.
sentences.chinese: 有六个感官对象得以进入的门。
